page.title: 04The London Docklands
page.content: The Docklands, which for many years were the nerve centre of Englands imports and exports, fell into gradual disuse after the Second World War. Some years ago the government created the London Docklands Development Corporation to revitalise the area. It is now a scene of great change. Many of the wharves, such as Gun Wharf and King Henry V's,are being converted into luxury appartments.Many of the warehouses are also being renovated. Some will become homes,some will become drama, art, music and dance studios, while others are fast becoming bases for thriving businesses. Even an airport is being planned. These developments have apparently caused a conflict of interest between the poor local community and the comparatively wealthy newcomers.
